title: Boris Johnson’s big Brexit offer decoded
text:
Boris Johnson’s big Brexit offer decoded The British prime minister warns of a historic ‘failure of statecraft’ if a deal cannot be done.

With just days to go before a crucial EU summit at which any Brexit deal will need to be signed off, Boris Johnson has made his big offer.

In a letter to Commission President Jean-Claude Juncker, the U.K. prime minister assures him Britain wants a deal and urges compromise from the EU. "If we cannot reach [a deal], it would represent a failure of statecraft for which we would all be responsible. Our predecessors have tackled harder problems: we can surely solve this one."

But the U.K.'s complex scheme for Northern Ireland to remain within the EU's regulatory zone for food while leaving its customs territory is already being viewed highly skeptically in Dublin and Brussels.

Here's POLITICO's guide to how to read Johnson's letter to Juncker. Click or tap the crosses to see the annotations.
